en: There is no evidence that anyone has been here in a long time except for the smell, that sickly sour stench designed to keep the living from the dead. I tell myself she can’t smell like that, but of course she can. We all can. I hold my forearm up to my nose so I can smell sweat and skin and anything but death.
vi: Chẳng có gì cho thấy lâu nay còn có người ở đây, trừ cái mùi, thứ mùi chua chua nồng nồng bệnh bệnh bốc lên để giữ người sống tránh xa người chết. Tôi tự nhủ Margo không thể nào có mùi như thế, nhưng tất nhiên là có thể rồi. Tất cả chúng ta đều có thể bốc mùi như vậy. Tôi giơ cánh tay chặn ngang mũi để ngửi mùi mồ hôi và da mình, bất kể mùi gì trừ cái chết.
vi_results: "title": "The Old Man and the Sea", "author": "Ernest Hemingway"
tr: Koku dışında, canlıları ölüden uzak tutmak için tasarlanmış bu hastalıklı derecede keskin olan pis koku dışında, burada uzun zamandır herhangi birinin olduğuna dair hiç kanıt yok. Kendime Margo’nun böyle kokamayacağım söylüyorum ama elbette kokabilir. Hepimiz kokabiliriz. Terin ve derinin yani ölümden başka bir şeylerin kokusunu almak için kolumu burnuma doğru kaldırıyorum.
es: No parece que haya pasado nadie por aquí desde hace tiempo, excepto por el olor, ese tufo rancio y dulzón que diferencia a los muertos de los vivos. Me digo a mí mismo que Margo no puede oler así, pero claro que puede. Todos podemos. Me llevo el brazo a la nariz para oler el sudor, la piel y cualquier cosa menos la muerte.
vi_translation: There was nothing to indicate that anyone had been here for a long time, except for the smell, that sour, pungent, sickly smell that kept the living away from the dead. I told myself that Margo couldn't possibly smell like that, but of course she could. All of us could smell like that. I raised my arm to my nose to smell my sweat and skin, anything but the smell of death.
tr_translation: Aside from the smell, this morbidly sharp stench designed to keep the living away from the dead, there is no evidence that anyone has been here for a long time. I tell myself that Margo couldn't smell like this, but of course, she could. We all could. I lift my arm to my nose to catch the scent of sweat and skin, anything other than death.
es_translation: It doesn't seem like anyone has been here for a long time, except for the smell, that rancid and sweetish stench that distinguishes the dead from the living. I tell myself that Margo can't smell like that, but of course she can. We all can. I bring my arm to my nose to smell the sweat, the skin, and anything but death.
st: Ha ho na bopaki ba hore mang kapa mang o bile mona ka nako e telele ntle le monko, hore stench e bolila e sa foleng e etselitsoeng ho boloka ba phelang bafung. Kea tseba hore ha a na monko o joalo, empa ha ho joalo. Kaofela ha rōna re ka khona. Ke ts'oara forearm ea ka ho fihlela nkong ea ka e le hore nka fofonela mofufutso le letlalo le ntho efe kapa efe ntle le lefu.
yo: Kò sí ẹ̀rí pé ẹnikẹ́ni ti wà níbí fún ìgbà pípẹ́ àyàfi òórùn náà, òórùn tí kò dára tí wọ́n ṣètò láti pa àwọn alààyè mọ́ kúrò nínú òkú. Mo sọ fún ara mi pé kò lè máa rùn bẹ́ẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ní tòótọ́ ó lè rùn bẹ́ẹ̀. Gbogbo wa lè ṣe é. Mo gbé apá iwájú mi sókè sí imú mi kí n lè gbóòórùn òógùn àti awọ ara àti ohunkóhun àyàn ikú.
tn: Ga go na bosupi jo bo bontshang gore ga go na ope yo o kileng a tshela lobaka lo loleele kwa ntle ga monko o o monate, o o sa bolong go tshela mo baswing. Ke ne ka ipolelela gore ga a kitla a nna le monko o o ntseng jalo, mme gone o ka kgona. Rotlhe re a kgona. Ke na le letso la me le le kwa godimo mo nkong ya me gore ke kgone go ja nama le letlalo fela.
ty: Aita e haapapuraa e ua faaea maoro mai te hoê taata i ǒ nei maoti râ te hâu'a, e te hâu'a avaava i hamanihia no te paruru i te feia ora i te pohe. E parau vau ia'u iho e, eita ta'na e nehenehe e hau'a mai te reira te huru, tera râ, e nehenehe ta'na. E nehenehe ta tatou paatoa. E tape'a vau i to'u rima i ni'a i to'u ihu ia nehenehe ia'u ia hau'a i te hou e te iri e te mau mea atoa maori râ te pohe.
mai: एहि बातक कोनो प्रमाण नहि अछि जे गंधकेँ छोड़ि कतेको दिन सँ कियो एतय आयल अछि, ओ बीमार खट्टा दुर्गन्ध जे जीवितकेँ मृतकसँ बचाबय लेल बनाओल गेल अछि। हम अपना सं कहैत छी जे ओ ओहन गंध नहि कए सकैत छथि, मुदा निश्चित रूप सं ओ कए सकैत छथि। हम सभ कए सकैत छी। हम अपन भुजा के नाक तक पकड़ैत छी जाहि सँ हमरा पसीना आ त्वचा आ मृत्यु के अलावा किछु सूंघ सकय।

en: The smell leaves me seized by desperate panic—panic not like my lungs are out of air, but like the atmosphere itself is out of air. I think maybe the reason I have spent most of my life being afraid is that I have been trying to prepare myself, to train my body for the real fear when it comes. But I am not prepared.
vi: Cái mùi ấy thít lấy tôi trong cơn hoảng loạn tuyệt vọng– hoảng loạn không phải như trong phổi tôi đã cạn sinh khí, mà như chính sinh quyển đã cạn khí. Tôi nghĩ có thể lí do tôi lo lắng hết phần lớn thời gian đời mình là vì tôi cố gắng tự chuẩn bị cho bản thân, rèn luyện cơ thể sẵn sàng chống lại nỗi sợ hãi đích thực khi nó tràn tới. Nhưng tôi không sẵn sàng.
tr: Koku beni çaresizlikle dolu bir panik tarafından ele geçirilmiş halde bırakıyor... ciğerlerimin havasız kalması gibi bir panik değil, atmosferin kendisinin havasız kalması gibi bir panik. Sanırım hayatımın çoğunu korkarak geçirdim çünkü gerçek korku geldiğinde kendimi onun için hazırlamaya, vücudumu eğitmeye çalışıyordum. Ama hazır değilim.
es: El olor hace que un desesperado pánico se apodere de mí. No como cuando mis pulmones se quedan sin aire, sino como cuando lo que se queda sin aire es la propia atmósfera. Creo que la razón por la que he pasado la mayor parte de mi vida asustado es quizá porque intentaba prepararme y entrenar mi cuerpo para cuando llegara el miedo de verdad. Pero no estoy preparado.
vi_translation: That smell gripped me in a panic of despair—not panic as if my lungs had run out of air, but as if the entire biosphere had run out of air. I think the reason I worry most of the time is that I try to prepare myself, training my body to be ready to fight against the true fear when it comes. But I am not ready.
tr_translation: Despair leaves me seized by a panic filled with helplessness... not a panic like my lungs running out of air, but a panic as if the atmosphere itself is running out of air. I think I spent most of my life in fear because when real fear came I was trying to prepare myself for him, to train my body. But I'm not ready.
es_translation: The smell causes a desperate panic to take hold of me. Not like when my lungs run out of air, but like when the very atmosphere runs out of air. I think the reason I've spent most of my life scared is perhaps because I was trying to prepare and train my body for when real fear arrived. But I am not prepared.

yo: Òórùn náà fi mí sílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìbẹ̀rù ńlá - ìbẹ̀rù kì í ṣe bí ẹ̀dọ̀fóró mi kò ní afẹ́fẹ́ mọ́, ṣùgbọ́n gẹ́gẹ́ bí afẹ́fẹ́ fúnra rẹ̀ kò ní afẹ́fẹ́ mọ́. Mo lérò pé bóyá ìdí tí mo fi lo ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbésí ayé mi láti bẹ̀rù ni pé mo ti ń gbìyànjú láti múra ara mi sílẹ̀, láti kọ́ ara mi fún ìbẹ̀rù gidi nígbà tí ó bá dé. Ṣùgbọ́n mi ò múra sílẹ̀.

en: He balls his hands into fists and then extends his fingers out. As I walk toward him, he starts talking to me. “When my mom was trying to keep me from getting beat up in third grade, she put me in tae kwon do. I only went to like three classes, and I only learned one thing, but the thing comes in handy sometimes: we watched this tae kwon do master punch through a thick wooden block, and we were all like, dude, how did he do that, and he told us that if you move as though your hand will go through the block, and if you believe that your hand will go through the block, then it will.”
en_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Diaz"
vi: Ben nắm tay lại thành nắm đấm rồi duỗi các ngón ra. Khi tôi tiến lại, nó bắt đầu kể. “Hồi tôi học lớp ba, mẹ tìm cách để tôi không bị bắt nạt nên cho tôi học lớp võ taekwondo. Hình như tôi chỉ đến lớp có ba buổi, và chỉ học được mỗi một chiêu, nhưng thỉnh thoảng cũng hữu hiệu ra phết: bọn nhóc tì xem sư phụ taekwondo đấm xuyên một tấm gỗ dày, đứa nào cũng trầm trồ hỏi sao thầy làm được, và thầy đã nói với cả lớp rằng nếu ta di chuyển như thể tay ta sẽ xuyên qua súc gỗ, và nếu ta tin rằng tay ta sẽ xuyên qua được, thì ắt nó xuyên được.”
tr: Ellerim yumruk haline getiriyor, sonra parmaklarım uzatıyor. Ben ona doğru yürürken, benimle konuşmaya başlıyor. “Annem beni üçüncü sınıfta dövülmekten korumaya çalıştığı zaman, tekvandoya yazdırdı. Yalnızca üç ders falan gittim ve sadece tek bir şey öğrendim ama o şey bazen işe yarıyor: O tekvando ustasının kalın bir tahtayı yumruklamasını izlerdik ve hepimiz, dostum, bunu nasıl yaptı falan gibi bakardık ve usta bize eğer eliniz tahtanın içinden geçecekmiş gibi hareket ederseniz ve elinizin tahtadan geçeceğine inanırsanız o zaman öyle olur, dedi.
es: Aprieta los puños y luego extiende los dedos. Mientras voy hacia él empieza a decirme: —En tercero, mi madre intentó que dejaran de pegarme apuntándome a taekwondo. Solo fui a tres clases, y solo aprendí una cosa, pero de vez en cuando es útil. Vimos al maestro de taekwondo partir un bloque grueso de madera y todos pensamos, colega, cómo lo ha hecho, y él nos dijo que si actúas como si tu mano fuera a atravesar el bloque de madera, y si crees que tu mano va a atravesar ese bloque, entonces lo atraviesa.
vi_translation: Ben clenched his hand into a fist and then stretched out his fingers. As I approached, he began to tell. "When I was in third grade, my mom tried to prevent me from being bullied by enrolling me in a taekwondo class. I think I only attended three sessions and learned just one move, but it was occasionally quite effective: the kids watched the taekwondo master punch through a thick wooden board, and they all marveled, asking how he did it. The master told the class that if we moved as if our hand would go through the board, and if we believed that our hand would go through, then it surely would."
tr_translation: I clench my hands into fists, then extend my fingers. As I walk towards him, he starts talking to me. “When my mom tried to protect me from being beaten up in third grade, she enrolled me in taekwondo. I only went to about three lessons and learned just one thing, but sometimes that one thing works: We would watch the taekwondo master punch through a thick board, and we would all look like, dude, how did he do that, and the master told us if you move your hand as if it’s going through the board and believe that your hand will go through, then it will happen.”
es_translation: Clench your fists and then extend your fingers. As I walk towards him, he starts to say to me: —In third grade, my mother tried to stop them from hitting me by signing me up for taekwondo. I only went to three classes, and I only learned one thing, but every now and then it's useful. We saw the taekwondo master break a thick block of wood and we all thought, dude, how did he do that, and he told us that if you act as if your hand is going to go through the block of wood, and if you believe that your hand is going to go through that block, then it goes through.
st: O ile a otlolla matsoho a hae ka matsoho ebe o otlolla menoana ea hae. Ha ke ntse ke tsamaea le eena, o qala ho bua le 'na. "Ha 'mè oa ka a ne a leka ho nkhulisa hore a se ke a otla ka sehlopheng sa boraro, o ile a kenya Tae Kwon. Ke ile feela joaloka litlelase tse tharo, 'me ke ile ka ithuta ntho e le' ngoe feela, empa ntho e fihla ka linako tse ling: re ile ra shebella tae kwon ena e otla ka seto se teteaneng sa lehong, 'me kaofela re ne re tšoana, dude, o ile a re etsa seo joang, 'me o ile a re bolella hore haeba u susumelletsa joalokaha eka letsoho la hao le tla feta ka block,  'Me haeba u lumela hore letsoho la hao le tla feta ka har'a block, joale ho tla ba joalo. "
yo: Ó gbá ọwọ́ rẹ̀ sínú ọwọ́ lẹ́yìn náà ó gbé ìka rẹ̀ jáde. Bí mo ṣe ń rìn tọ̀ ọ́ wá, ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní bá mi sọ̀rọ̀. "Nígbà tí ìyá mi ń gbìyànjú láti dẹ́kun kí wọ́n lù mí ní ìpele kẹta, ó fi mí sínú tae kwon ṣe. en: The light comes on, and I still can’t see very well, but I can tell we’ve stepped into a big room filled with a labyrinth of metal shelves. The papers on the floor are pages from an old day-by-day calendar, the days scattered through the room, all of them yellowing and mouse-bit. I wonder if this might once have been a little bookstore, although it’s been decades since these shelves held anything but dust.
en_results: "title": "The Particular Sadness of Lemon Cake", "author": "Aimee Bender"
vi: Ánh sáng rọi đến, tôi vẫn chẳng thấy gì rõ rệt, nhưng có thể nói được rằng chúng tôi đang ở trong một căn phòng rộng, đầy một mê hồn trận những giá sắt. Đống giấy trên sàn là từ lịch xé hàng ngày, những tờ lịch rải rác rơi khắp phòng, tất cả đều đã ố vàng và bị chuột gặm. Tôi tự hỏi không biết nơi này có từng là một hiệu sách nhỏ hay không, dù hàng thập kỉ đã trôi qua và trên giá không có gì ngoài bụi.
vi_results: "title": "The Shadow of the Wind", "author": "Carlos Ruiz Zafón"
tr: Işık yanıyor ve hâlâ çok iyi göremiyorum ama metal raflardan oluşan bir labirentle dolu büyük bir odaya adım attığımızı anlayabiliyorum. Yerdeki kâğıtlar eski bir takvimden yapraklar, günler odanın etrafına dağılmış, hepsi sararmış ve fareler tarafından kemirilmiş. Buranın bir zamanlar küçük bir kitapçı olup olmadığını merak ediyorum, bununla beraber bu raflar tozdan başka bir şey tutmayalı on yıllar olmuş.
tr_results: "title": "The Shadow of the Wind", "author": "Carlos Ruiz Zafon"
es: Sigo sin ver muy bien, pero está claro que hemos entrado en una gran sala con un laberinto de estanterías metálicas. Los papeles del suelo son páginas de un viejo calendario. Los días están esparcidos por la sala, todos ellos amarillentos y mordidos por los ratones. Me pregunto si esto pudo ser una librería, aunque hace décadas que los estantes no albergan otra cosa que polvo.
vi_translation: The light shone in, I still couldn't see anything clearly, but it could be said that we were in a large room, filled with a labyrinth of iron shelves. The pile of papers on the floor was from a daily torn calendar, the scattered pages falling all over the room, all yellowed and gnawed by mice. I wondered if this place had ever been a small bookstore, though decades had passed and there was nothing on the shelves but dust.
tr_translation: The light is on and I still can't see very well, but I can understand that we have stepped into a large room filled with a labyrinth of metal shelves. The papers on the floor are pages from an old calendar, days scattered around the room, all yellowed and gnawed by mice. I wonder if this place was once a small bookstore, however, these shelves haven't held anything but dust for decades.
es_translation: I still can't see very well, but it's clear that we have entered a large room with a labyrinth of metal shelves. The papers on the floor are pages from an old calendar. The days are scattered around the room, all of them yellowed and gnawed by mice. I wonder if this could have been a bookstore, although the shelves have housed nothing but dust for decades.
st: Leseli le ntse le tsoela pele, 'me ke ntse ke sitoa ho bona hantle haholo, empa ke khona ho re joetsa hore re kene ka phapusing e kholo e tletse labyrinth ea lishelefo tsa tšepe. Lipampiri tse mokatong ke maqephe a khalendara ea khale ea letsatsi le letsatsi, matsatsi a hasaneng ka kamoreng, kaofela ha tsona li mosehla le mouse-bit. Kea ipotsa hore na e kile ea e-ba lebenkele le lenyenyane la libuka, leha e se e le lilemo tse mashome ho tloha ha lishelefo tsena li ne li tšoeroe ke letho haese lerōle.
yo: Iná náà tàn, mi ò sì tíì rí i dáadáa, ṣùgbọ́n mo lè sọ pé a ti wọ inú yàrá ńlá tí ó kún fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ pẹpẹ irin. Àwọn ìwé tó wà lórí ilẹ̀ jẹ́ ojú ìwé láti inú kàlẹ́ńdà ojoojúmọ́ àtijọ́, àwọn ọjọ́ tí wọ́n fọ́nká nínú yàrá náà, gbogbo wọn ni wọ́n ń ṣe òféèfé àti eku díẹ̀. Mo ń rò ó bóyá èyí lè jẹ́ ilé ìtajà ìwé kékeré rí, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó ti tó ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún láti ìgbà tí àwọn pẹpẹ wọ̀nyí ti mú ohunkóhun àyàbá eruku.
tn: Lesedi le ne le sa kgone go bona sentle, mme ke sa ntse ke kgona go bona sentle, fela ke kgona go re bolelela gore re tsene mo kamoreng e kgolo e e tletseng labyrinth ya dis shelvese tsa tshipi. Dipampiri tse di mo mmung ke ditsebe go tswa mo khalendareng ya letsatsi le letsatsi, malatsi a a gasagantsweng mo kamoreng, tsotlhe di bosetlha le di-mouse-bit. Ke ipotsa gore a e kile ya bo e setse e le mo dingwageng di le mmalwa tse di fetileng, le fa e ne e le dingwaga di le masome a matlhano tse di neng di le teng, di ne di sa ntse di le teng.
ty: Te ama noa ra te mori, e aita vau e ite maitai ra, tera râ, e nehenehe ta'u e parau e, ua taahi matou i roto i te hoê piha rahi tei î i te mau pa'epa'e auri. Te mau api parau i ni'a i te tahua, e mau api ïa no roto mai i te hoê tarena tahito no te mau mahana atoa, te mau mahana e purara ra na roto i te piha, e mea re'are'a e te tarapahi. Te uiui nei to'u mana'o e, ua riro anei te reira ei fare hooraa buka na'ina'i, noa'tu e, e rave rahi matahiti i teie nei to teie mau paepae tape'araa i te repo puehu.
mai: बत्ती आबि जाइत अछि, आ हम एखनो नीक जकाँ नहि देखि सकैत छी, मुदा हम कहि सकैत छी जे हम धातुक अलमारीक भूलभुलैयासँ भरल एकटा पैघ कोठरीमे पैर रखलहुँ अछि। फर्श पर कागज सभ दिन-प्रतिदिन पुरान कैलेंडरक पृष्ठ अछि, जे दिन कोठरीमे बिखरल अछि, सभटा पीयर भऽ रहल अछि आ मूस-बिट अछि। हमरा आश्चर्य अछि जे की ई कहियो कने किताबक दोकान रहल होयत, यद्यपि दशक बीत गेल अछि जखन एहि अलमारीमे धूलक अतिरिक्त किछु छल।
mg: Tonga ny hazavana, ary mbola tsy mahita tsara aho, saingy afaka milaza aho fa niditra tao amin'ny efitrano lehibe feno talantalana vy izahay. en: Radar shines the light through the hole as I duck down and lead the way through. This room is entirely empty except for a rolled carpet in one corner. As the flashlight scans the floor, I can see glue stains on the concrete from where the carpet had once been. Across the room, I can just make out another hole cut into the wall, this time without the graffiti.
en_results: "title": "The Perks of Being a Wallflower", "author": "Stephen Chbosky"
vi: Radar chiếu đèn qua cái lỗ ấy trong khi tôi khom người chui qua đầu tiên. Căn phòng bên này hoàn toàn trống không, trừ tấm thảm cuộn lại trong góc. Khi đèn chiếu xuống sàn, tôi thấy những vệt keo còn trên nền bê-tông, chỗ trước ắt là có tấm thảm. Nhìn qua phòng, tôi thấy thêm một lỗ thông trên tường nữa, lần này không có chữ viết.
vi_results: "title": "The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn", "author": "Hergé"
tr: Radar ışığı deliğin içine tutuyor, ben de çömelip içeri giriyorum. Bu oda bir köşedeki rulo yapılmış hah dışında tamamen boş. Fener yeri tararken, betonun üzerinde bir zamanlar halının olduğu yerdeki yapıştırıcı lekelerini görebiliyorum. Odanın karşısında, duvara kazılmış sadece başka bir delik daha görebiliyorum, bu sefer duvarda yazı yok.
es: Radar enfoca la linterna hacia el agujero, y yo me agacho y entro el primero. Lo único que hay en la sala es una moqueta enrollada en una esquina. La linterna recorre el suelo y veo manchas de cola en el hormigón, donde antes había estado la moqueta. Al fondo de la sala descubro otro agujero abierto en la pared, esa vez sin grafiti.
vi_translation: Radar shone the light through the hole while I bent down and crawled through first. The room on this side was completely empty, except for a rolled-up carpet in the corner. When the light shone on the floor, I saw glue streaks still on the concrete, where there must have been a carpet before. Looking across the room, I saw another vent hole on the wall, this time without any writing.
tr_translation: Radar shines the light into the hole, and I crouch down and go inside. This room is completely empty except for a rolled-up rug in one corner. As the flashlight scans the area, I can see adhesive stains on the concrete where a carpet once was. On the opposite side of the room, I can see just another hole dug into the wall, but this time there is no writing on the wall.
es_translation: Radar focuses the flashlight towards the hole, and I crouch down and enter first. The only thing in the room is a rolled-up carpet in a corner. The flashlight scans the floor and I see glue stains on the concrete, where the carpet used to be. At the back of the room, I discover another hole in the wall, this time without graffiti.
st: Radar e khanyetsa lebone ka sekoting ha ke ntse ke le duck fatše ebe ke tsamaisa tsela. Kamore ena ha e na letho ntle le k'hapete e koahetsoeng ka har'a k'hapete e le 'ngoe. Ha flashlight e skena fatše, ke bona matheba a sekhomaretsi ka konkreite ho tloha moo k'hapete e kileng ea ba teng. Ka kamoreng, nka ntša lesoba le leng le khaotsoe leboteng, lekhetlong lena ntle le graffiti.
yo: Radar tan iná náà kọjá nínú ihò bí mo ṣe ń sá lọ tí mo sì ń darí ọ̀nà kọjá. Yàrá yìí ṣófo pátápátá àyàfi ti kápẹ́ẹ̀tì tí wọ́n yí ní igun kan. Bí iná iná náà ṣe ń ṣe àyẹ̀wò ilẹ̀, mo lè rí àwọn àbàwọ́n lẹ̀pọ̀ lórí kọ́kọ́rẹ́ẹ̀tì láti ibi tí kápẹ́ẹ̀tì náà ti wà rí. Ní òdìkejì yàrá náà, mo kàn lè ṣe ihò mìíràn tí wọ́n gé sínú ògiri, ní àsìkò yìí láìsí àwọn ohun tí wọ́n fi ń pè ní graffiti.
tn: Lesedi le ne la phatsimisa lesedi fa ke ntse ke tsamaya ke bo ke ntse ke tsamaya. Kamore e, ga e na sepe fela fa e se fela mo sekhutlwaneng se le sengwe mo sekhutlwaneng se le sengwe. Fa di ntse di le kwa tlase, ke kgona go bona ditshika tse di neng di le mo teng ga mebila e e neng e le teng. Fa ke le mo kamoreng ya me, ke kgona go dira gore go nne le lesoba le lengwe fela mo leboteng, mo lekgetlong leno fa ke sena go dirisa di-gras.
ty: E anaana te maramarama i roto i te apoo a pou ai au i raro e a arata'i ai au i te e'a. Aita e taata i roto i teie piha, eiaha râ te hoê vauvau tahua i roto i te hoê poro. I te tahi a'e pae o te piha, e nehenehe noa ta'u e hamani i te tahi atu apoo tei tapuhia i ni'a i te papa'i, i teie râ taime, aita ïa e apoo.
mai: रडार छेदक माध्यमसँ प्रकाशकेँ चमकबैत अछि जखन हम नीचा बतख करैत छी आ रास्ता लऽ जाइत छी। एकटा कोना मे लुढ़कल कालीन के छोड़ि ई कमरा पूरा तरह सँ खाली अछि। जेना-जेना टॉर्च फर्शकेँ स्कैन करैत अछि, हम कंक्रीटपर गोंदक दाग देखि सकैत छी जतय सँ कालीन कहियो छल। कमरा के पार, हम दीवार मे काटल एकटा आओर छेद बना सकैत छी, एहि बेर बिना भित्तिचित्र के।

en: Talking like this to her kept me calm, strangely. It kept me from imagining the possibilities. I came again to the sagging wooden sign for Grovepoint Acres. I could almost hear the sighs of relief from the bottleneck behind me as I turned left onto the dead-end asphalt road. It looked like a driveway without a house. I left RHAPAW running and got out. From close up, I could see that Grovepoint Acres was more finished than it initially appeared. Two dirt roads ending in cul-de-sacs had been cut into the dusty ground, although the roads had eroded so much I could barely see their outlines. As I walked up and down both streets, I could feel the heat in my nose with each breath. The scalding sun made it hard to move, but I knew the beautiful, if morbid, truth: heat made death reek, and Grovepoint Acres smelled like nothing except cooked air and car exhaust—our cumulative exhalations held close to the surface by the humidity.
vi: Kì lạ là nói to lên như vậy khiến tôi bình tĩnh hơn. Tôi không vẽ ra các giả thuyết nữa. Lại đi qua tấm bảng gỗ cũ kĩ đề Grovepoint Acres, tôi gần như nghe thấy tiếng thở phào nhẹ nhõm từ đám thắt cổ chai phía sau khi tôi rẽ trái vào con đường cụt trải nhựa. Trông như một lối đi không dẫn vào căn nhà nào. Tôi cứ để RHAPAW chạy hết dải đường ấy. Lại gần, Grovepoint Acres có vẻ hoàn thiện hơn là thoạt nhìn. Hai con đường đất dẫn vào một vòng cung cụt, giao cắt nhau thành những mảng trống bụi bặm. Dù đường đã bị xói lở nhiều, tôi vẫn hơi thấy được các mép đường. Đi đi lại lại trên hai con phố ấy, tôi cảm nhận được hơi nóng phả ra từ hai cánh mũi mình, theo từng nhịp thở. Mặt trời nóng như rang khiến đi lại khá mệt, nhưng tôi tự hiểu một sự thật đẹp đẽ, dù có thể hơi xuẩn ngốc: cái nóng sẽ khiến mùi chết chóc phải sộc lên, và Grovepoint Acres chỉ bốc lên mùi không khí bị hun nóng và mùi khói xe–những phát thải tích tụ, bị cái ẩm đẩy xuống gần mặt đất.
tr: Tuhaf bir biçimde, onunla bu şekilde konuşmak beni sakinleştirdi. Olasılıkları hayal etmemi engelledi. Tekrar yamuk duran, tahta Grovepoint Acres tabelasına geldim. Sola, çıkmaz asfalt yola dönerken arkamdakilerden gelen ferahlama iç çekişlerini neredeyse duyabiliyordum. Evsiz bir garaj yolu gibi görünüyordu. SESIB’ı çalışır halde bırakıp indim. Yakından, Grovepoint Acres’m başta göründüğünden daha fazla tamamlanmış olduğunu görebildim. Tozlu zemine çıkmazlarla sonlanan iki toprak yol kazılmıştı, yollar oldukça aşınmış olmasına rağmen, ana hatlarını zar zor görebiliyordum. İki yolda da ileri geri yürürken, her nefesimle birlikte burnumda sıcaklığı hissedebiliyordum. Yakıcı güneş hareket etmeyi zorlaştırıyordu ama ben biraz hastalıklı olmasına rağmen iyi hissettiren gerçeği biliyordum: Sıcaklık ölümü kokuturdu ve Grovepoint Acres pişmiş hava ve araba egzozu dışında bir şey kokmuyordu...
es: Por raro que parezca, dirigirme a ella en voz alta me tranquilizaba. Evitaba que imaginara las diversas posibilidades. Llegué al letrero de madera roída de Grovepoint Acres. Casi oí los suspiros de alivio de los que me seguían cuando giré a la izquierda hacia la carretera asfaltada sin salida. Parecía un camino de acceso a una casa pero sin casa. Dejé el Chuco en marcha y salí. Al acercarme, vi que Grovepoint Acres estaba más acabado de lo que en un primer momento parecía. Habían abierto en el suelo dos caminos de tierra sin salida, aunque se habían erosionado tanto que apenas se veían los contornos. Recorrí las dos calles arriba y abajo sintiendo el calor en la nariz cada vez que respiraba. El sol abrasador dificultaba el movimiento, pero sabía la bonita, aunque macabra, verdad: el calor hace que los muertos apesten, y Grovepoint Acres solo olía a aire caliente y tubos de escape. La humedad hacía que la acumulación de exhalaciones se mantuviera en el aire a mi alrededor.
vi_translation: Strangely, speaking out loud like that made me calmer. I no longer conjured up hypotheses. Passing the old wooden sign that read Grovepoint Acres again, I almost heard a sigh of relief from the bottleneck behind me as I turned left onto the paved dead-end road. It looked like a path that didn't lead to any house. I let RHAPAW run the entire length of that road. Up close, Grovepoint Acres seemed more complete than it initially appeared. Two dirt roads led into a cul-de-sac, intersecting each other into dusty patches. Although the roads were heavily eroded, I could still faintly see the edges. Walking back and forth on those two streets, I felt the heat emanating from my nostrils with each breath. The sun was scorching, making the walk quite tiring, but I understood a beautiful, albeit slightly foolish, truth: the heat would force the smell of death to rise, and Grovepoint Acres only emitted the scent of heated air and car exhaust—the accumulated emissions pushed down close to the ground by the humidity.
tr_translation: Strangely, talking to him this way calmed me down. It prevented me from imagining the possibilities. I arrived again at the crooked, wooden Grovepoint Acres sign. As I turned left onto the dead-end asphalt road, I could almost hear the sighs of relief from those behind me. It looked like a driveway without a house. I left the SESIB running and got out. Up close, the Grovepoint Acres’ initially I could see that it was more completed than it appeared. Two dirt roads that ended in dead ends were dug into the dusty ground; although the roads were quite worn, I could barely see their outlines. As I walked back and forth on both roads, I could feel the warmth in my nose with every breath. The scorching sun made it difficult to move, but I knew the truth that felt good despite being a bit sickly: The heat smelled of death, and Grovepoint Acres smelled of nothing but cooked air and car exhaust...
es_translation: As strange as it may seem, speaking to her out loud calmed me. It prevented me from imagining the various possibilities. I reached the worn wooden sign of Grovepoint Acres. I almost heard the sighs of relief from those following me when I turned left onto the dead-end paved road. It seemed like an access road to a house but without a house. I left the Chuco running and got out. As I approached, I saw that Grovepoint Acres was more rundown than it initially appeared. They had opened two dead-end dirt roads in the ground, although they had eroded so much that the outlines were barely visible. I walked up and down the two streets, feeling the heat in my nose with each breath. The scorching sun made movement difficult, but I knew the pretty, though macabre, truth: heat makes the dead stink, and Grovepoint Acres only smelled of hot air and exhaust fumes. The humidity caused the accumulation of exhalations to linger in the air around me.
st: Ha ke bua ka sena, o ile a etsa hore ke khutse, ka tsela e makatsang. Sena se ile sa etsa hore ke se ke ka nahana ka menyetla. ʻO ka hoʻomaka me ka hoʻoponopono ʻana i ka hoʻoholo ʻana i ka hoʻoholo ʻana. Ke ne ke batla ke utloa li-sighs tsa liphallelo tse tsoang ho botlolo ea ka kamora 'na ha ke tloha tseleng e shoeleng ea asphalt. E ne e shebahala joalo ka ha eka ke tsela e se nang ntlo. ʻO ka hana ʻo Ho tloha qalong, ke ile ka bona hore Grovepoint Acres e felile ho feta kamoo e neng e hlaha qalong. Litsela tse peli tse litšila tse qetellang ka cul-de-sacs li ne li khaotsoe mobung o lerōle, le hoja litsela li ne li sentse haholo hoo ke neng ke sa khone ho bona litšoantšo tsa tsona. Ha ke ntse ke nyoloha le ho theoha literateng ka bobeli, nka utloa mocheso nkong ea ka ka phefumoloho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe. The scalding letsatsi etsa hore ho be thata ho fallela, empa ke ne ke tseba e ntle, haeba morbid, 'nete: mocheso entse lefu reek, le Grovepoint Acres nkhang hamonate joaloka letho ntle phehiloe moea le koloi qeta monono rona exhalations tšoaroa haufi le ho mongobo.
yo: Sísọ̀rọ̀ báyìí sí i kò jẹ́ kí ara mi balẹ̀, ní àjòjì. Ó dí mi lọ́wọ́ láti fojú inú wo àwọn àfààní náà. Mo tún wá sí àmì igi tí ó ń rìn fún Grovepoint Acres. Mo fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ gbọ́ ìtura láti ọrùn ìgò lẹ́yìn mi bí mo ṣe yí padà sí òsì sí ọ̀nà asphalt tó kú. Ó jọ ọ̀nà ìrìnnà láìsí ilé. Mo fi RHAPAW sílẹ̀ sáré mo sì jáde. Láti ìparí, mo rí i pé Grovepoint Acres ti parí ju bí ó ṣe kọ́kọ́ farahàn lọ. Àwọn ọ̀nà ìdọ̀tí méjì tí ó parí ní ọ̀nà-de-sacs ni wọ́n ti gé sí ilẹ̀ eruku, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn ọ̀nà náà ti bàjẹ́ púpọ̀ tí mi ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ rí àlàkalẹ̀ wọn. Bí mo ṣe ń rìn sókè àti sọ̀kalẹ̀ ní òpópónà méjèèjì, mo lè ní ìmọ̀lára ooru inú imú mi pẹ̀lú èémí kọ̀ọ̀kan. Oòrùn tó ń fẹ̀ jẹ́ kí ó nira láti rìn, ṣùgbọ́n mo mọ òtítọ́ tó rẹwà, tí ó bá jẹ́ ìbànújẹ́, òtítọ́: ooru jẹ́ kí ikú tún rùn, Grovepoint Acres sì ń rùn bí nkankan àyàfi afẹ́fẹ́ tí wọ́n sè àti èéfín ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ - àkójọpọ̀ àwọn èémí wa tí ó súnmọ́ ojú ilẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ ọ̀rinrin.
tn: O ne a bua jalo le ene a ne a dira gore ke ikutlwe ke ritibetse maikutlo a me. Seno se ne sa dira gore ke se ka akanya ka dilo tse di ka dirang gore ke se ka ka nna le tsone. Ke ne ka boela kwa go hudugela kwa morago ga go bona gore go ne go na le ditshupa tse di neng di le kwa godimo tsa 1000. Ke ne ke kgôna go utlwa fa ke ne ke le mo tseleng e e neng e le teng fa ke ne ke le mo tseleng e e neng e le teng. E ne e kete ke tsela e e senang legae. I'm Gone Ridin' And Gone Go tswa foo, ke ne ke kgona go lemoga gore go ne go na le dilo tse dingwe tse di neng di le gaufi le go feta fa go ne go lebega go ne go na le tsone. Go ne go na le ditsela di le pedi tse di rurufetseng tse di neng di le mo mmung, le fa go ne go na le ditsela tse dintsi tse di neng di sa kgone go di bona. Fa ke ntse ke tsamaya ka dinao le mo mebileng, ke ne ke kgona go bona mogote mo nkong ya me ka phefumoloho nngwe le nngwe. Letsatsi le ne la dira gore go nne thata go tsamaya, mme ke ne ke itse bontle, fa ke ne ke utlwa botlhoko, boammaaruri: mogote o ne wa dira gore go nne le loso, le diheketara tsa Grovepoint di ne di nkga jaaka go se na sepe fa se se apeilwe ke phefo le koloi e e neng e apesitswe ka tsela e e feteletseng e e neng e tshwerwe ke metsi.
ty: I to ' u paraparauraa ' tu ia ' na mai teie te huru, ua vai hau noa vau, ma te huru ê. Ua tapea te reira ia ' u ia feruri i te mau ravea. Ua haere faahou mai au i te tapa'o raau no Grovepoint Acres. Ua fatata roa vau i te faaroo i te oto o te tamărûraa i roto i te mohina i muri ia'u a huri ai au i ni'a i te purumu tei î i te taata. E au ra e aita e fare faahou. Ua faarue atura vau ia RHAPAW e ua haere atura vau i rapae. Mai te haamataraa mai â, ua ite au e ua oti a'e te oire no Grovepoint Acres i te itehia i te omuaraa. Ua tâpûhia e piti purumu repo i roto i te repo puehu, noa'tu e, ua ino roa te purumu, e aita e ti'a ia'u ia ite i to ratou huru. A haere noa ' i au na roto i na aroâ e piti, e nehenehe au e ite i te veavea i roto i to ' u ihu e te aho tataitahi. No te anaana o te mahana, e mea fifi roa ia tere, tera râ, ua ite au i te nehenehe, e te nehenehe, e te parau mau : e mea ve'ave'a roa te pohe, e ua hau'a roa te repo o grovepoint Acres i te hoê mea maori râ, te mata'i e te pereoo uira—to matou mau hutiraa aho tei tapirihia i ni'a i te fenua e te haumi.
mai: हुनका सं एहि तरहेँ गप्प करब हमरा शांत रखलक, अजीब तरहेँ। इ हमरा संभावनाक कल्पना करए सं रोकि देलक। हम फेर ग्रोवपॉइंट एकर्स के लेल लकड़ी के झुलसैत चिन्ह पर आबि गेलहुं। जखन हम मृत अंत डामर सड़क पर बामाँ मुड़लहुँ तखन हम अपन पाछूक अड़चनसँ राहतक सांस लगभग सुनि सकैत छलहुँ। ई बिना घर के ड्राइववे जकां लगैत छल। हम आरएचएपीएडब्ल्यू के दौड़ैत छोड़लहुं आ बाहर निकलि गेलहुं। लगसँ हम देख सकैत छी जे ग्रोवपॉइंट एकर्स शुरू सँ बेसी तैयार छल। कुल-डी-थैलीमे समाप्त होबयवला दूटा गन्दगी सड़ककेँ धूल भरल जमीनमे काटि देल गेल छल, यद्यपि सड़कसभ एतेक क्षीण भऽ गेल छल जे हम ओकर रूपरेखा मुश्किल सँ देखि सकैत छलहुँ। जेना-जेना हम दुनू गलीमे ऊपर-नीचाँ चलि रहल छलहुँ, हम प्रत्येक साँसक सङ्ग अपन नाकमे गर्मी अनुभव कऽ सकैत छलहुँ। खसैत घामक कारण चलनाइ कठिन भऽ गेल, मुदा हम सुन्दर, जँ मोर्बिड, सत्य जनैत छलहुँ: गर्मीसँ मृत्यु तेज भऽ गेल, आ ग्रोवप्वाइंट एकर्स पकाएल हवा आ कारक निकासक अतिरिक्त किछु नहि सुगंधित छल- हमर संचयी साँस छोड़ब आर्द्रतासँ सतहक निकट राखल गेल छल।
mg: Ny firesahana toy izany taminy dia nahatonga ahy ho tony, hafahafa. Nanakana ahy tsy haka sary an-tsaina ny mety ho azo atao izany. Niverina tany amin'ny marika hazo nihoson-drano ho an'ny Grovepoint Acres indray aho. Saika henoko ny fisentoan'ny fahamaivanana avy amin'ny bottleneck tao aoriako rehefa nitodika teo amin'ny lalana asfalta efa maty aho. Toy ny hoe tsy misy trano ilay izy. Niala tao amin'ny RHAPAW aho ary nivoaka. Avy any amin'ny farany, hitako fa vita kokoa noho ny tamin'ny voalohany ny Grovepoint Acres. Lalana roa feno loto niafara tamin'ny cul-de-sacs no tapaka tao amin'ny tany feno vovoka, na dia nihena be aza ny lalana ka zara raha nahita ny endrik'izy ireo aho. Rehefa nandeha teny amin'ireo arabe roa ireo aho dia nahatsapa ny hafanana tao amin'ny oroko isaky ny nifoka fofonaina. Nanasarotra ny fifindràna ny masoandro niposaka, saingy fantatro ny fahamarinana tsara tarehy, raha toa ka manjombona: ny hafanana no nahatonga ny fahafatesana ho toy ny reek, ary ny Grovepoint Acres dia tsy nisy na inona na inona afa-tsy ny rivotra masaka sy ny faharendrehan'ny fiara—ny fivangongoan'ny fivangongoan'ny tany izay natao teo akaikin'ny tany noho ny hamandoana.

en: Unlike the previous pseudovisions, someone was keeping up Quail Hollow. No houses had been built, but the lots were marked with surveying stakes, and the grass was freshly mown. All the streets were paved and named with road signs. In the subdivision’s center, a perfectly circular lake had been dug and then, for some reason, drained. As I drove up in the minivan, I could see it was about ten feet deep and several hundred feet in diameter. A hose snaked across the bottom of the crater to the middle, where a steel-and-aluminum fountain rose from the bottom to eye level. I found myself feeling thankful the lake was empty, so I wouldn’t have to stare into the water and wonder if she was in the bottom somewhere, expecting me to put on scuba gear to find her.
vi: Không giống như những đô thị ma trước, Quail Hollow có người nhòm nom đến. Chưa có ngôi nhà nào được xây, nhưng các lô đất được đánh dấu bằng cọc địa giới, và thảm cỏ mới được cắt. Các con phố trong khu này được lát và đề tên đàng hoàng. Ở trung tâm tiểu khu, một cái hồ tròn vành vạnh đã được đào xong, nhưng không hiểu sao chưa dẫn nước vào. Chạy xe qua, tôi ước chừng cái hồ sâu khoảng ba mét, đường kính tầm hơn một trăm mét. Một đường ống cao su chạy ngoằn ngoèo trong lòng hồ, nối vào chính giữa, nơi một đài phun nước bằng nhôm và thép được dựng từ đáy lên ngang tầm mắt. Tôi lấy làm mừng vì hồ đang cạn, tức là tôi không phải chằm chằm nhìn mặt nước, tự hỏi không biết Margo có ở dưới đáy không, có đang đợi tôi mặc bộ đồ lặn xuống tìm cô ấy không.

tr: Önceki semtimsilerin aksine, birileri Quail Hollow’u ayakta tutuyordu. Hiç ev inşa edilmemişti ama arsalar tetkik çubuklarıyla işaretlenmişti ve çimler yeni biçilmişti. Bütün sokaklar asfaltlanmış ve sokak tabelalarıyla isimlendirilmişti. Semtin merkezinde mükemmel bir şekilde dairesel bir göl kazılmış ve sonra nedense boşaltılmıştı. Minivanla ilerlerken gölün yaklaşık üç metre de rinliğinde ve yaklaşık 100 metre çapında olduğunu görebildim. Bir hortum, kraterin dibinden geçerek, çelik ve alüminyum bir çeşmenin dipten göz hizasına doğru yükseldiği orta kısma doğru kıvrıla kıvrıla gidiyordu. Kendimi gölün boş olduğuna şükrederken buldum, böylece suya bakmak ve Margo’nun, onu bulmak için tüple dalmamı bekleyerek, dipte bir yerlerde olup olmadığını merak etmek zorunda kalmayacaktım.
es: A diferencia de las pseudovisiones anteriores, alguien se ocupaba del mantenimiento de Quail Hollow. No habían construido casas, pero las parcelas estaban señaladas con postes y el césped estaba recién podado. Todas las calles estaban asfaltadas y tenían placas con el nombre. En el centro de la urbanización habían construido un lago perfectamente circular y, por alguna razón, lo habían vaciado. Mientras me acercaba con el coche vi que debía de tener un metro de profundidad y unos ciento cincuenta de diámetro. Una manguera zigzagueaba por el fondo hasta el centro, donde se alzaba una fuente de acero y aluminio. Me descubrí a mí mismo alegrándome de que el lago estuviera vacío, porque así no tendría que mirar fijamente el agua preguntándome si Margo estaba en el fondo, esperando que me pusiera un traje de buzo para encontrarla.
vi_translation: Unlike previous ghost towns, Quail Hollow has someone looking after it. No houses have been built yet, but the lots are marked with boundary stakes, and the grass has been freshly cut. The streets in this area are paved and properly named. In the center of the subdivision, a perfectly round lake has been dug, but for some reason, no water has been led into it yet. Driving by, I estimated the lake to be about three meters deep, with a diameter of over a hundred meters. A rubber pipe runs windingly inside the lake, connected to the center, where a fountain made of aluminum and steel is erected from the bottom up to eye level. I was glad the lake was dry, meaning I didn't have to stare at the water, wondering if Margo was at the bottom, waiting for me to dive in and find her.
tr_translation: Unlike the previous neighborhoods, someone was keeping Quail Hollow alive. No houses had been built, but the plots were marked with survey stakes and the lawns were freshly mowed. All the streets were paved and named with street signs. In the center of the neighborhood, a perfectly circular lake had been dug and then for some reason drained. As we moved forward in the minivan, about three meters of the lake I could see that it was round and about 100 meters in diameter. A hose, passing from the bottom of the crater, was winding its way towards the middle part where a steel and aluminum fountain rose from the bottom to eye level. I found myself grateful that the lake was empty, so I wouldn't have to look into the water and wonder if Margo was somewhere at the bottom, waiting for me to dive in with a scuba tank to find her.
es_translation: Unlike the previous pseudovisions, someone was in charge of maintaining Quail Hollow. They hadn't built houses, but the plots were marked with posts and the grass was freshly mowed. All the streets were paved and had name plates. In the center of the development, they had built a perfectly circular lake and, for some reason, they had drained it. As I approached with the car, I saw that it must have been about a meter deep and about one hundred fifty in diameter. A hose zigzagged across the bottom to the center, where a steel and aluminum fountain stood. I found myself glad that the lake was empty, because that way I wouldn't have to stare at the water wondering if Margo was at the bottom, waiting for me to put on a diving suit to find her.
st: Ho fapana le li-pseudovisions tse fetileng, motho e mong o ne a boloka Quail Hollow. Ho ne ho se na matlo a neng a hahiloe, empa lotho e ne e tšoauoa ka lithupa tsa ho hlahloba, 'me joang bo ne bo sa tsoa bohoa. Literata tsohle li ne li koahetsoe 'me li bitsoa ka matšoao a tsela. Bohareng ba subdivision, ho ne ho cheka letša le chitja ka ho phethahetseng ebe, ka lebaka le itseng, le tsoetsoe. Ha ke ntse ke khanna ka har'a minivan, ke ne ke bona e ka ba limithara tse leshome botebo le bophara ba makholo a 'maloa ka bophara. Noha ea hose ka mose ho tlase ea crater ho ea bohareng, moo seliba sa tšepe-le-aluminium se ileng sa phahama ho tloha tlase ho isa boemong ba mahlo. Ke ile ka iphumana ke leboha letša le ne le se na letho, ka hona ke ne ke sa tlameha ho sheba ka har'a metsi ebe ke ipotsa hore na o ne a le ka tlase kae, a lebelletse hore ke behe gear ea scuba ho mo fumana.
yo: Kì í ṣe àwọn pseudovisions tẹ́lẹ̀, ẹnìkan ń tọ́jú Quail Hollow. Wọn kò tí ì kọ́ ilé kankan, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n ṣe àmì ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ náà pẹ̀lú ìwádìí owó, wọ́n sì ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gbin koríko náà. Gbogbo àwọn òpópónà ni wọ́n pa tí wọ́n sì fi àmì ọ̀nà dárúkọ wọn. Ní àárín ìpín náà, wọ́n ti gbẹ́ adágún yíká pípé lẹ́yìn náà, fún ìdí kan, wọ́n ti gbẹ́. Bí mo ṣe ń wa ọkọ̀ sókè nínú ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ kékeré náà, mo rí i pé ó jìn tó ẹsẹ̀ mẹ́wàá àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọgọ́rùn-ún ẹsẹ̀ ní ìwọ̀n. Òpó kan kọjá ìsàlẹ̀ ihò náà sí àárín, níbi tí orísun irin àti aluminiomu ti gòkè láti ìsàlẹ̀ dé ìpele ojú. Mo rí ara mi tí mo dúpẹ́ pé adágún náà ṣófo, nítorí náà mi ò ní nílò láti wo inú omi kí n sì ṣe ìyàlẹ́nu bóyá ó wà ní ìsàlẹ̀ ní ibìkan, tí mò ń retí kí n wọ ohun èlò omi láti wá a.
tn: Go farologana le batho ba ba neng ba le mo nakong e e fetileng, go ne go na le mongwe yo o neng a sa ntse a le mo tseleng e e neng e le mo go yone. Go ne go se na matlo a a neng a agiwa, mme bontsi jwa bone bo ne bo tshwailwe ka ditlhotlhomiso, mme bojang bo ne bo le kwa godimo thata. Mebila yotlhe e ne ya bewa mme ya bidiwa ka matshwao a tsela. Ka ntlha ya fa go ne go na le lefelo le le neng le le mo go lone, go ne go na le lefelo le le neng le le mo go lone, mme ka ntlha ya mabaka mangwe, go ne ga nna le letshitshi. Fa ke ntse ke le mo tseleng, ke ne ke kgona go lemoga gore e ne e le dimetara di le 100 tsa yone tse di kwa godimo le dimetara di le 10. Noga ya hose e ne e kgabaganya kwa tlase ya khuti go ya bogare, fa sediba sa tshipi le aluminium se ne sa tsoga go tswa kwa tlase go ya kwa tlase go ya kwa godimo. Ke ne ka ikutlwa ke le gaufi le letsha, ka jalo ke ne ke sa tlhoke go itse gore a o ne a le kwa tlase kwa tlase, ke ne ke sa batle go mo fitlhela.
ty: Taa ê atu i te mau afata teata na mua ' tu, te tapea ra te hoê taata i te Quail Hollow. Aita e fare i patuhia, tera râ, ua î roa te aua i te mau tĭtĭ apî, e e mea tapu-nehenehe-maitai-hia te aihere. Ua tâhia te mau aroâ atoa e ua mairihia i te i'oa e te mau tapao purumu. I ropu i taua vahi ra, ua ǒhia te hoê roto menemene maitai roa e i muri iho, no te tahi tumu, ua faatahehia. A tere noa ai au na ni'a i te pereoo, ua ite a'era vau e, fatata hoê ahuru metera i te hohonu e e rave rahi hanere metera i te hohonu. Ua ohu noa te hoê pape pu'e i te tahi pae o te apoo e tae roa'tu i ropu, i reira te hoê pape pu'e auri e te apoopoo i te ti'araa mai raro e tae roa'tu i te faito mata. Ua ite au e, ua mauruuru roa vau i te mea e, aita e taata i roto i te roto, no reira, aita e titauhia ia'u ia hi'o i roto i te pape e ia uiui e, tei raro anei oia i te pape, ma te ti'aturi e, e oomo vau i te ahu taoto no te imi ia'na.
mai: पछिला छद्म दर्शनक विपरीत, कियो बटेर खोखला राखि रहल छल। कोनो घर नहि बनाओल गेल छल, मुदा लॉटसभकेँ सर्वेक्षणक दाँवसँ चिन्हित कयल गेल छल, आ घास ताजा काटल गेल छल। सभटा सड़कक नाम पक्का छल आ सड़कक संकेतसँ नामकरण कयल गेल छल। अनुमंडलक केन्द्रमे एकटा पूर्ण गोलाकार झील खोदल गेल छल आ तखन कोनो कारणसँ निकासी भऽ गेल छल। जखन हम मिनीवैनमे चलि रहल छलहुँ, हम देख सकैत छलहुँ जे ई लगभग दस फीट गहींर आ कतेको सय फीट व्यासक छल। एकटा नली गड्ढाक निचला भागमे बीचमे नग्न भऽ गेल, जतय स्टील आ एल्यूमीनियमक फव्वारा नीचाँसँ आँखिक स्तर धरि उठल। हम अपनाकेँ आभारी महसूस करैत देखलहुँ जे झील खाली छल, तेँ हमरा पानिमे घूरय नहि पड़त आ आश्चर्य करय पड़त जे की ओ कतहु तलमे छलीह, आशा करैत छी जे हम ओकरा तकबाक लेल स्कूबा गियर पहिरब।
mg: Tsy toy ny pseudovisions teo aloha, nisy olona nitazona ny Quail Hollow. Tsy nisy trano naorina, saingy voamarika tamin'ny alalan'ny fandinihana ireo tsatòka ireo toerana, ary vao avy nojinjaina ny bozaka. Ny arabe rehetra dia vita amin'ny takela-by ary nomena anarana tamin'ny takela-by famantarana. Tao afovoan'ny zana-tsampana, nisy farihy boribory tsara dia nohavahana ary avy eo, noho ny antony maro, dia ritra. Rehefa niakatra tao anatin'ilay fiara kely aho dia hitako fa teo amin'ny 10 metatra ny halaliny ary an-jatony metatra ny sakany. Nisy fantsona iray nisidina teo amin'ny fanambanin'ilay vava volkano ka hatrany afovoany, izay nisy loharano vy sy alimo niakatra avy any amin'ny farany ambany ka hatrany amin'ny haavon'ny maso. Tsapako fa feno fankasitrahana aho fa foana ilay farihy, ka tsy nila nijery tao anaty rano aho ary nanontany tena raha toa izy ka tany amin'ny toerana ambany, nanantena ahy hametraka fitaovana scuba mba hahitana azy.

en: I rotated the bottle around and saw, unambiguously, a tiny smear of blue spray paint on the outside of the bottle. From her spray-painted fingers. I could be sure now. She’d been here after we parted ways that morning. Maybe she was still staying here. Maybe she only showed up late at night. Maybe she had taped up the particleboard to keep her privacy.
vi: Tôi xoay xoay cái lọ và thấy, không nghi ngờ gì nữa, một vết bé xíu sơn xanh da trời lem trên vỏ lọ. Lem từ ngón tay dính sơn xanh da trời của Margo. Bây giờ tôi có thể chắc chắn được rồi. Cô ấy đã đến đây sau khi chúng tôi tạm biệt nhau buổi sáng hôm ấy. Có lẽ cô ấy còn ở đây. Có lẽ phải khuya cô ấy mới xuất hiện. Có lẽ cô ấy đã dán băng dính lên tấm gỗ ép để bảo toàn sự riêng tư.
tr: Şişeyi etrafında döndürdüm ve şişenin dışında, tartışmasız bir şekilde, mavi sprey boyanın lekesini gördüm. Onun sprey boyayla boyanmış parmaklarından geliyordu. Artık emin olabilirdim. O sabah yollarımızı ayırdıktan sonra Margo buraya gelmişti. Belki de hâlâ burada kalıyordu. Belki de yalnızca gece geç saatte ortaya çıkıyordu. Belki de mahremiyetini korumak için levhayı o bantlamıştı.
es: Giré el frasco y vi sin el menor género de duda una diminuta mancha de espray azul en la parte externa del vidrio. De sus dedos manchados de espray. Entonces estuve seguro. Había estado allí después de que nos separáramos aquella mañana. Quizá todavía estaba allí. Quizá solo salía por la noche. Quizá había puesto la cinta en el conglomerado para mantener la privacidad.
vi_translation: I rotated the jar and saw, without a doubt, a tiny smudge of sky-blue paint on its surface. Smeared from Margo's sky-blue paint-stained finger. Now I could be certain. She had come here after we said goodbye that morning. Perhaps she was still here. Perhaps she would only appear late at night. Perhaps she had taped the plywood to maintain her privacy.
tr_translation: I turned the bottle around and saw, undeniably, the stain of blue spray paint on the outside of the bottle. It was coming from her spray-painted fingers. Now I could be sure. After we parted ways that morning, Margo had come here. Maybe she was still staying here. Maybe she only appeared late at night. Maybe she had taped the sign to protect her privacy.
es_translation: I turned the jar and saw without the slightest doubt a tiny blue spray stain on the outside of the glass. From his spray-stained fingers. Then I was sure. He had been there after we parted that morning. Maybe he was still there. Maybe he only came out at night. Maybe he had put the tape on the conglomerate to maintain privacy.
st: Ke ile ka potoloha botlolo ho potoloha le ho bona, unmbiguously, smear e nyane ea pente e putsoa ea spray ka ntle ho botlolo. Ka menoana ea hae e tsoang ho sesepa sa menoana. Mohlomong ke na le bonnete ba hore nka ba le bonnete ba hona joale. 'Me ba ne ba lula moo ka mor'a hore re kopane le eena hoseng hona. Mohlomong o ile a lula mona. O ne a mpa a batla ho tsoha hoseng haholo. Mohlomong o ne a ka be a ile a kenya makhasi ho boloka lekunutu la hae.
yo: Mo yí ìgò náà káàkiri mo sì rí i, láìṣe ìtumọ̀, ọ̀dà aláwọ̀ búlúù kékeré kan ní ìta ìgò náà. Láti ọwọ́ àwọn ìka ọwọ́ rẹ̀ tí wọ́n kùn lọ́dà fínfín. Ó lè dá mi lójú báyìí. Ó ti wà níbí lẹ́yìn tí a pínyà ní àárọ̀ ọjọ́ náà. Bóyá ó ṣì ń gbé níbí. Bóyá alẹ́ nìkan ló wá. Bóyá ó ti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ẹ̀yà náà láti pa ìkọ̀kọ̀ rẹ̀ mọ́.
tn: Ke ne ka dikologa le go bona, go se na motlhaba o o mo tala, o o neng o le mo godimo ga pente e e kwa ntle ga lebotlolo. Ka menwana ya gagwe e e tshwantshitsweng. Nka tlhomamisega ka gone jaanong. 'O ne a tlhôla fa a ne a le teng mo mosong ono' - She has been there by the morning ways Gongwe o ne a sa ntse a tlile go nna fa. 'She was late late at night' - O ne a tlhôma fêla bosigo Gongwe o ne a ka tswa a ne a tshwentswe ke ditshika tsa gagwe gore a nne le sephiri sa gagwe.

en: I rolled out the carpet farther and found a blue knit blanket, almost newspaper thin. I grabbed it and held it to my face and there, God, yes. Her smell. The lilac shampoo and the almond in her skin lotion and beneath all of that the faint sweetness of the skin itself.
en_results: "title": "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo", "author": "Stieg Larsson"
vi: Tôi trải nốt tấm thảm ra và thấy một cái chăn len đan màu xanh da trời, mỏng gần như giấy báo. Tôi vội cầm lấy và đưa lên mặt, phải rồi, ơn Chúa, đúng vậy. Mùi của Margo. Dầu gội đầu mùi tử đinh hương và kem dưỡng da mùi hạnh nhân, lẩn quất trong đó thoáng chút ngọt ngào của làn da.
tr: Halıyı daha fazla açtım ve neredeyse kâğıt inceliğinde mavi örgü bir battaniye buldum. Battaniyeyi alıp yüzüme doğru tuttum ve orada, Tanrım, evet... Margo’nun kokusu. Leylaklı şampuan, bademli cilt losyonu ve bütün bunların altında teninin bayıltıcı tatlılığı.
tr_results: "title": "The Perks of Being a Wallflower", "author": "Stephen Chbosky"
es: Desenrollé un poco más la moqueta y encontré una manta azul de punto, casi tan fina como un periódico. La cogí, me la llevé a la cara y sí, sí. Su olor. El champú de lilas y la loción de almendras, y más allá, la débil suavidad de su piel.
vi_translation: I spread out the rest of the carpet and saw a sky-blue knitted wool blanket, thin almost like newspaper. I hurriedly grabbed it and brought it to my face, yes, thank God, that's right. The scent of Margo. Lilac-scented shampoo and almond-scented lotion, with a faint sweetness of skin lingering within.
tr_translation: I opened the carpet further and found an almost paper-thin blue knitted blanket. I took the blanket and held it up to my face and there, my God, yes... Margo's scent. Lilac shampoo, almond skin lotion, and beneath it all, the intoxicating sweetness of her skin.
es_translation: I unrolled the carpet a bit more and found a blue knitted blanket, almost as thin as a newspaper. I picked it up, brought it to my face and yes, yes. Its smell. The lilac shampoo and almond lotion, and beyond that, the faint softness of her skin.

en: In my dream, her head was on my shoulder as I lay on my back, only the corner of carpet between us and the concrete floor. Her arm was around my rib cage. We were just lying there, sleeping.
en_results: "title": "The Perks of Being a Wallflower", "author": "Stephen Chbosky"
vi: Tôi nằm mơ, mái đầu Margo gối lên vai tôi còn tôi nằm thẳng, chỉ có góc thảm giữa chúng tôi và sàn bê-tông. Cánh tay cô ấy ôm ngang người tôi. Chúng tôi nằm đó, say ngủ.
tr: Ivüyamda, ben sırtüstü yatarken Margo’nun başı omzumdaydı, aramızda yalnızca halının köşesi ve beton zemin vardı. Kolu göğsüme sarılıydı. Orada öylece uyuyarak yatıyorduk.
es: En mi sueño, yo estaba tumbado boca arriba, y ella tenía la cabeza apoyada en mi hombro. Solo la moqueta nos separaba del suelo de cemento. Me rodeaba el pecho con el brazo. Estábamos simplemente tumbados, durmiendo.
vi_translation: I dreamed, Margo's head resting on my shoulder while I lay straight, with only the corner of the carpet between us and the concrete floor. Her arm wrapped around me. We lay there, sound asleep.
tr_translation: In my room, while I was lying on my back, Margo's head was on my shoulder, with only the corner of the carpet and the concrete floor between us. Her arm was wrapped around my chest. We were just lying there, sleeping.
es_translation: In my dream, I was lying on my back, and she had her head resting on my shoulder. Only the carpet separated us from the cement floor. She had her arm around my chest. We were simply lying down, sleeping.
st: Ka toro, hlooho ea hae e ne e le lehetleng ha ke ntse ke beha mokokotlong oa ka, ke sekhutlo feela sa k'hapete lipakeng tsa rona le mokatong oa konkreite. ʻO ka mea hoʻomaka a me ka ʻōnae ʻōnae. Re ne re robetse feela, re robetse.

en: He sniffed and shook his head, then awoke. He reached up to rub his eyes and seemed surprised to find an empty can of Milwaukee’s Best Light attached to his right hand. He tried to make a fist and dented the can some, but did not dislodge it. He looked at it for a minute, and then nodded. “The Beast is stuck to me,” he noted.
en_results: "title": "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy", "author": "Douglas Adams"
vi: Nó khụt khịt lúc lắc đầu, rồi tỉnh ngủ. Nó định dụi mắt và có vẻ ngạc nhiên thấy một lon Milwaukee’s Best Light rỗng dính trên tay phải. Nó cố nắm tay lại bóp bẹp cái lon nhưng không ăn thua. Ben nhìn lon bia chừng một phút rồi gật đầu thốt lên, “Quái vật cứ bám riết lấy tôi!”
vi_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Diaz"
tr: Burnunu çekti, başım salladı, sonra uyandı. Gözlerini ovuşturmak için ellerini yukan kaldırdı ve sağ eline yapışık boş Müwaukee’s Best Light kutusu bulunca şaşırmış gibi göründü. Elini yumruk yapmaya çalıştı ve kutuyu biraz ezdi ama yerinden çıkarmadı. Kısa bir süre kutuya baktı, sonra başmı salladı. “Canavar9 bana yapışıp kalmış,” diye bildirdi. 9 MIwaukee’s Best birası “The Beast” yani “Canavar” olarak da adlandırılmaktadır. (ç. n.

es: Olisqueó, movió la cabeza y se despertó. Levantó las manos para frotarse los ojos y pareció sorprenderse de ver una lata de Milwaukee’s Best Light pegada en su mano. Intentó cerrar el puño y abollar un poco la lata, pero no se la pudo arrancar. La miró un minuto y movió la cabeza. —La Bestia está pegada a mí —observó.
vi_translation: It sniffled and shook its head, then woke up. It intended to rub its eyes and seemed surprised to see an empty Milwaukee’s Best Light can stuck to its right hand. It tried to crush the can by squeezing it but to no avail. Ben looked at the beer can for about a minute, then nodded and exclaimed, "The monster keeps clinging to me!"
tr_translation: He sniffled, nodded his head, then woke up. He raised his hands to rub his eyes and seemed surprised when he found an empty Milwaukee’s Best Light can stuck to his right hand. He tried to make a fist and crushed the can a bit but didn’t remove it. He looked at the can for a short while, then nodded his head. “The monster9 has stuck to me,” he reported. Milwaukee’s Best beer is also referred to as "The Beast" or "Canavar". (tr. n.)
es_translation: He sniffed, moved his head, and woke up. He raised his hands to rub his eyes and seemed surprised to see a can of Milwaukee’s Best Light stuck to his hand. He tried to close his fist and dent the can a bit, but he couldn't tear it off. He looked at it for a minute and shook his head. "The Beast is stuck to me," he observed.

en: “I’m too hungover to mediate,” Radar answered quietly. He lay down on the bed, his eyes half closed, and rubbed his buzzed hair. “It’s like I got hit by lightning.” He sniffed. “Okay, bring me up-to-date.” I sat down in the desk chair and told Radar about my evening in Margo’s vacation house, trying hard not to leave out any possibly helpful details. I knew Radar was better at puzzles than I, and I was hoping he’d piece together this one.
en_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Diaz"
vi: “Tôi oải đến mức chẳng buồn hòa giải hai ông nữa,” Radar khẽ đáp. Nó nằm vật xuống giường, mắt nhắm hờ, bới bới mái đầu bù xù. “Cảm giác như tôi vừa bị trúng sét vậy,” nó khụt khịt nói. “Được rồi, ông cập nhật tình hình đi.” Tôi ngồi xuống ghế bên bàn học và kể cho Radar nghe cả đêm tôi đã ở trong chỗ trú chân của Margo ra sao, hết sức cố gắng không bỏ sót bất cứ chi tiết nào có thể hữu ích. Tôi biết Radar có tài giải mã câu đố hơn tôi, và tôi mong là lần này nó có thể khớp được các mảnh ghép vào nhau.
tr: “Ara buluculuk yapmak için fazla akşamdan kalmayım,” ıliye cevapladı Radar sessizce. Yatağa uzandı, gözleri yarı kapalı, kazınmış saçlarım ovuşturdu. “Sanki yıldırım çarpmış gibiyim.” Burnunu çekti. “Tamam, yeni haberleri ver.” Sandalyeye oturdum ve faydalı olma ihtimali bulunan hiçbir detayı atlamamaya gayret ederek, Radar’a Margo’nun tatil evindeki akşamımı anlattım. Kadar’m bulmacalarda benden daha iyi olduğunu biliyordum ve bu bulmacanın parçalarını birleştireceğini umuyordum.
es: —Estoy demasiado resacoso para mediar entre vosotros —me contestó con tono calmado. Se tumbó en la cama, con los ojos medio cerrados, y se frotó el pelo, casi rapado—. Es como si me hubiera caído encima un rayo. —Resopló—. Bueno, ponme al día. Me senté en la silla del escritorio y le conté a Radar lo de mi noche en el edificio por el que había pasado Margo, intentando no dejarme ningún detalle significativo. Sabía que Radar era mejor que yo con los rompecabezas, así que esperaba que ensamblara las piezas de este.
vi_translation: “I'm so exhausted that I don't even want to mediate between you two anymore,” Radar quietly replied. He collapsed onto the bed, eyes half-closed, scratching his messy hair. “I feel like I've just been struck by lightning,” he sniffled. “Alright, give me an update.” I sat down on the chair by the study desk and told Radar about how I had spent the entire night in Margo's hideout, trying my best not to leave out any potentially useful details. I knew Radar was better at solving puzzles than I was, and I hoped that this time he could piece everything together.
tr_translation: “I'm too hungover to play mediator,” Radar replied quietly. He lay down on the bed, eyes half-closed, rubbing his shaved head. “I feel like I've been struck by lightning.” He sniffled. “Alright, give me the latest news.” I sat down on the chair and, trying not to omit any potentially useful detail, recounted my evening at Margo's vacation house to Radar. I knew Kadar was better at puzzles than I was, and I hoped he would piece together this puzzle.
es_translation: —I'm too hungover to mediate between you —he answered me in a calm tone. He lay down on the bed, with his eyes half-closed, and rubbed his nearly shaved hair—. It's like a lightning bolt hit me. —He sighed—. Well, catch me up. I sat in the desk chair and told Radar about my night in the building Margo had passed through, trying not to leave out any significant details. I knew that Radar was better than me with puzzles, so I hoped he would assemble the pieces of this one.
st: "Ke khathetse haholo ho ea mediate," ha araba Radar ka khutso. O ile a robala betheng, mahlo a hae a koetsoe, 'me a hlatsoa moriri oa hae o mofubelu. "E like me ka hoʻohaʻi i ka lightning." O ile a tsoetsoa. "Ho ho ho, bring me up." Ke ile ka lula setulong sa deske mme ka bolella Radar ka mantsiboea a ka ntlong ea phomolo ea Margo, ke leka ka thata hore ke se ke ka tsoa lintlha tse thusang. Ke ne ke tseba hore li-spammers li ne li le betere ho feta nna, 'me ke ne ke ts'epa hore o tla li kopanya.
yo: Radar dáhùn ní ìdákẹ́jẹ́ẹ́. Ó dùbúlẹ̀ lórí ibùsùn, ojú rẹ̀ pa ní ìdajì, ó sì fọ́ irun rẹ̀ tí ó ń gbọ̀n. "Ó dàbí ẹni pé mọ́nàmọ́ná kọlu mi." Ó gbọ́. "O dara, mu mi soke-si-ọjọ." Mo jókòó lórí àga tábìlì mo sì sọ fún Radar nípa ìrọ̀lẹ́ mi ní ilé ìsinmi Margo, mo ń gbìyànjú gidigidi láti má ṣe fi àwọn àlàyé ìrànlọ́wọ́ kankan sílẹ̀. Mo mọ̀ pé Radar dára nínú àwọn ìṣòro ju èmi lọ, mo sì ní ìrètí pé yóò so èyí papọ̀.

en: “Yeah, well, it’s a fine idea, but it happens to be bullshit. They’re not trying to spread the black Santa gospel. If they were, they’d make black Santas. Instead, they’re trying to buy the entire world supply. There’s this old guy in Pittsburgh with the second-biggest collection, and they’re always trying to buy it off him.”
vi: “Được thôi, xuất phát là một ý tưởng hay, nhưng thực tế diễn ra thì dẩm dớ. Bố mẹ tôi sẽ không truyền giảng sách phúc âm về ông già Noel da đen đâu. Nếu muốn thế thì họ đã tự làm ra các ông già Noel da đen rồi. Đằng này, họ chỉ tìm cách mua lại từ nguồn cung sẵn có thôi. Có một ông cụ ở Pittsburgh sở hữu bộ sưu tập lớn thứ hai, bố mẹ tôi suốt ngày gạ mua lại bộ sưu tập của ông cụ.”
vi_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Diaz"
tr: “Evet, şey, iyi bir fikir ama zırvalık. Ebeveynlerim zenci Nn*| babayı yaymaya çalışmıyor. Öyle olsaydı, zenci Noel baba yaparlarda Bunun yerine dünya stoğunun tamamım satm almaya çalışıyı ular. Pittsburgh’da dünyadaki en büyük ikinci koleksiyona sahip lıif adam var ve sürekli koleksiyonu ondan satm almaya çalışıyorlar,"
es: —Sí, bueno, como idea está bien, pero resulta que es una gilipollez. No pretenden expandir el dogma del Santa Claus negro. Si fuera eso, harían Santa Claus negros. Pero lo que hacen es intentar comprar todas las reservas mundiales. En Pittsburgh hay un viejo que tiene la segunda colección más grande del mundo, y siempre intentan comprársela.
vi_translation: “Alright, starting off is a good idea, but the actual execution is clumsy. My parents are not going to preach the gospel about a black Santa Claus. If they wanted that, they would have created black Santa Clauses themselves. Instead, they are just trying to buy from the existing supply. There is an old man in Pittsburgh who owns the second largest collection, and my parents are always trying to buy his collection.”
tr_translation: “Well, it's a good idea but nonsense. My parents are not trying to spread the black Santa Claus. If they were, they would make a black Santa Claus, but instead, they are trying to buy the entire world stock. There is a man in Pittsburgh who has the second largest collection in the world, and they are constantly trying to buy the collection from him,"
es_translation: —Yes, well, as an idea it's fine, but it turns out to be nonsense. They don't intend to expand the dogma of a black Santa Claus. If that were the case, they would make black Santa Clauses. But what they do is try to buy all the world's reserves. In Pittsburgh, there's an old man who has the second largest collection in the world, and they always try to buy it from him.
st: "Ee, ke mohopolo o motle, empa ho etsahala hore ke sethosa. Ha ba leke ho phatlalatsa Kosepele e ntšo ea Santa. Haeba ho joalo, ba ne ba tla etsa li-santas tse ntšo. Ho e-na le hoo, ba leka ho reka lefatše lohle. Ho na le moshanyana enoa oa khale oa Pittsburgh ka pokello ea bobeli e kholo ka ho fetisisa, 'me ba lula ba leka ho e reka. "
yo: "Äà, íà ìîé âçãëÿä, ó ìåíÿ íåò íè÷åãî. Wọn kò gbìyànjú láti tan ìhìnrere Santa dúdú náà ká. Tí wọ́n bá jẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀, wọn á ṣe Santas dúdú. Kàkà bẹ́ẹ̀, wọ́n ń gbìyànjú láti ra gbogbo ìpèsè àgbáyé. Ọkùnrin àgbàlagbà yìí wà ní Pittsburgh pẹ̀lú àkójọpọ̀ kejì tí ó tóbi jùlọ, wọ́n sì máa ń gbìyànjú láti rà á lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀."
tn: "Yes, that's a good idea, but that's a bullshit. Ga ba a ka ba leka go phatlalatsa Efangele ya ga Jehofa e e ntsho. Fa ba ne ba ka dira jalo, ba ne ba tla nna le di-santa tse di ntsho. Go na le moo, ba leka go reka lefatshe lotlhe. 'Go na le ênê mosimane yo o nang le bojalô jo bo kwa godimo thata' - There is the old man in the second-old man, and they are always try to buy him
ty: " E mana'o maitai roa te reira, tera râ, e ere i te mea ohie. Aita ratou e tamata nei i te haaparare i te evanelia ereere. Mai te peu e e, e hamani ïa ratou i te papa Noela ereere. en: I only recognized the turnoff for Collier Farms because I’d become something of an expert in hard-to-see dirt access roads. But Collier Farms was like none of the other pseudovisions I’d seen, because it was wildly overgrown, as if it had been abandoned for fifty years. I didn’t know if it was older than the other pseudovisions, or if the low-lying, swamp-wet land made everything grow faster, but the Collier Farms access road became impassable just after I turned in because a thick grove of brambly brush had sprouted across the entire road.
vi: Tôi nhận ra lối rẽ vào Collier Farms chỉ vì tôi đã thành chuyên gia xác định những con đường lờ mờ lẫn vào đất. Nhưng Collier Farms không giống khu đô thị ma nào tôi từng đến. Nơi này cỏ dại mọc um tùm, như thể đã bị bỏ hoang năm chục năm nay rồi. Không rõ thâm niên nơi này có cao hơn những đô thị ma khác không, hay do địa thế thấp, đất đầm lầy ẩm mà mọi thứ mọc nhanh hơn. Tôi vừa rẽ đã thấy không thể đi tiếp được theo đường vào Collier Farms vì những bụi mâm xôi đâm lên um tùm chắn hết lối đi.
tr: Collier Farms sapağını fark edebildim çünkü görülmesi zor toprak yolları görmede uzman gibi bir şey olmuştum. Fakat Collier Farms gördüğüm diğer semtimsilere hiç benzemiyordu, çünkü sanki elli yıl önce terk edilmiş gibi yabani bir şekilde çalılarla kaplanmıştı. Diğer semtimsilerden daha eski olup olmadığını ya da her şeyin daha hızlı büyümesine neden olan bataklıklı bir zemini olup olmadığım bilmiyordum ancak Collier Farms’m giriş yolu ben oraya döndükten hemen sonra geçit vermez hale geldi çünkü yolun iki tarafında da sık bir dikenli çalı korusu yetişmişti.
es: Solo reconocí el desvío hacia Collier Farms porque me había convertido en un experto en caminos sin asfaltar difíciles de ver. Pero Collier Farms era diferente de las demás pseudovisiones que había visitado. Estaba extremadamente descuidada, como si llevara cincuenta años abandonada. No supe si era más antigua que las otras o si la tierra baja y pantanosa había hecho que todo creciera más deprisa, pero en cuanto me metí por el desvío me resultó imposible seguir avanzando, porque todo el camino estaba cubierto de gruesos arbustos.
vi_translation: I recognized the turn into Collier Farms only because I had become an expert at identifying the faint roads blending into the ground. But Collier Farms was unlike any ghost town I had ever been to. This place was overgrown with weeds, as if it had been abandoned for fifty years. It was unclear whether this place had been abandoned longer than other ghost towns, or if the low terrain and swampy, damp soil caused everything to grow faster. As soon as I turned, I saw that I couldn't continue down the road into Collier Farms because the overgrown blackberry bushes blocked the entire path.
tr_translation: I was able to notice the Collier Farms turnoff because I had become something of an expert at spotting hard-to-see dirt roads. But Collier Farms was unlike any other neighborhood I had seen, because it was overgrown with wild bushes as if it had been abandoned fifty years ago. I didn't know if it was older than the other neighborhoods or if it had a swampy ground that caused everything to grow faster, but the entrance road to Collier Farms became impassable right after I turned onto it because a dense thicket of thorny bushes had grown on both sides of the road.
es_translation: I only recognized the turnoff to Collier Farms because I had become an expert in spotting hard-to-see unpaved roads. But Collier Farms was different from the other pseudovisions I had visited. It was extremely neglected, as if it had been abandoned for fifty years. I didn't know if it was older than the others or if the low, swampy land had made everything grow faster, but as soon as I took the turnoff, it became impossible to keep going because the entire road was covered with thick bushes.
st: Ke ile ka hlokomela feela turnoff bakeng sa Collier Farms hobane ke ne ke tla ba ntho e 'ngoe ea setsebi litseleng tse thata ho fihlella litšila. Empa Collier Farms e ne e le e 'ngoe ea li-pseudovisions tse ling tseo ke neng ke li bone, hobane e ne e phahame haholo, joalo ka ha eka e lahliloe ka lilemo tse mashome a mahlano. Ke ne ke sa tsebe hore na e ne e le moholo ho feta pseudovisions tse ling, kapa haeba mobu o tlase, mobu o metsi o phofshoang o ile oa etsa hore ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe e hōle ka potlako, empa tsela ea ho fihlella ea Collier Farms e ile ea fetoha lefeela feela kamora hore ke fetohe hobane meru e teteaneng ea brush ea brambly e ne e le teng tseleng eohle.
yo: Mo kàn mọ ìyípadà fún Collier Farms nítorí mà á di ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n ní àwọn ọ̀nà ìwọlé ìdọ̀tí tí ó ṣòro láti rí. Ṣùgbọ́n Collier Farms kò dàbí ọ̀kankan nínú àwọn pseudovisions mìíràn tí mo ti rí, nítorí pé ó ti dàgbà gan-an, bí ẹni pé wọ́n ti kọ̀ ọ́ sílẹ̀ fún àádọ́ta ọdún. Mi ò mọ̀ bóyá ó ti dàgbà ju àwọn pseudovisions yòókù lọ, tàbí bóyá ilẹ̀ kéékèèké, tí ó tutù jẹ́ kí gbogbo nkan dàgbà ní kíákíá, ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀nà ìwọlé Collier Farms di aláìlágbára lẹ́yìn tí mo wọlé nítorí igbó fẹ́lẹ́ brambly tí ó nípọn ti jáde kọjá gbogbo ọ̀nà.
tn: Ke ne ka lemoga fela gore ke ne ke le mo polaseng ka gonne ke ne ke le moitseanape wa go nna moitseanape wa ditsela tse di thata. Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go sa ntse go na le batho ba ba neng ba le mo dingwageng tse di masome a matlhano tse ke neng ke setse ke di bone, ka gonne ba ne ba sa kgone go dira jalo ka dingwaga di le 50. en: “Just like you,” she said, smiling. This sentiment struck me as hilarious, but I didn’t say anything. She stood up and pulled me into her, kissing me on the cheek. “I really like being your mom,” she said.

vi: “Y như con nhỉ,” mẹ cười. Cảm giác đó làm tôi thấy phấn chấn, nhưng tôi không nói gì. Mẹ đứng dậy kéo tôi vào lòng, hôn lên má tôi. “Mẹ thích làm mẹ của con lắm.”

es: —Como tú —me dijo sonriendo. Aquel ataque sentimental me pareció un tanto hilarante, pero no dije nada. Se levantó, tiró de mí y me dio un beso en la mejilla. —Me gusta mucho ser tu madre —me dijo.
vi_translation: “Just like you, huh,” mom laughed. That feeling made me feel elated, but I didn't say anything. Mom stood up, pulled me into her arms, and kissed my cheek. “I love being your mom.”
tr_translation: “Just like you,” she said, smiling. This comment seemed funny to me, but I didn't say anything. She stood up, pulled me towards her, and kissed me on the cheek. “I really enjoy being your mother,” she said.
es_translation: —Like you —he told me, smiling. That sentimental outburst seemed somewhat hilarious to me, but I didn't say anything. She stood up, pulled me, and gave me a kiss on the cheek. —I really like being your mother —she told me.

Một lỗ ghim còn nguyên nữa là ở phía trên Chicago. Một lỗ ghim bị rách ở New York, căn cứ theo vị trí lỗ thủng trên tường, là một trong năm khu của thành phố New York.

en: I disentangled myself from my parents and shouted “thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you” as I raced through the living room, and yanked open the front door wearing only an old T-shirt and boxer shorts. There, parked in the driveway with a huge blue bow on it, was a Ford minivan.
vi: Tôi gỡ mình ra khỏi bố mẹ và hét toáng lên “cảm ơn bố cảm ơn mẹ cảm ơn bố cảm ơn mẹ cảm ơn bố cảm ơn mẹ” trong khi chạy vù qua phòng khách, mở vèo cửa trước, trên người chỉ có cái áo phông cũ và quần đùi. Kia, đỗ ở lối đi và được thắt một cái nơ xanh da trời bự chảng, là một chiếc Ford minivan.

tr: Kendimi onlardan kurtardım, oturma odasma doğru koşarken, “teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler’’ diye bağırdım ve üstümde yalnızca eski bir tişört ve boxer’la sokak kapısını hızla çekip açtım. Orada, üstünde kocaman mavi bir fiyonkla garaj yoluna park edilmiş bir Ford minivan vardı.
tr_results: "title": "The Perks of Being a Wallflower", "author": "Stephen Chbosky"
es: Solté a mis padres, grité «gracias gracias gracias gracias gracias gracias» corriendo por el comedor y abrí la puerta de la calle vestido solo con una camiseta vieja y calzoncillos. Aparcado en el camino de entrada, con un enorme lazo azul, había un monovolumen Ford.
vi_translation: I pulled myself away from my parents and screamed, "Thank you, Dad! Thank you, Mom! Thank you, Dad! Thank you, Mom! Thank you, Dad! Thank you, Mom!" while dashing through the living room, flinging open the front door, wearing only an old t-shirt and shorts. There, parked in the driveway and adorned with a huge sky-blue bow, was a Ford minivan.
tr_translation: I freed myself from them, running towards the living room, shouting, "thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you" and quickly opened the street door, wearing only an old t-shirt and boxers. There, parked on the driveway with a huge blue bow on it, was a Ford minivan.
es_translation: I let go of my parents, shouted "thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you" while running through the dining room, and opened the front door dressed only in an old t-shirt and underwear. Parked in the driveway, with a huge blue bow, was a Ford minivan.
st: Ke ile ka ithiba ho batsoali ba ka mme ka hoeletsa "Kea leboha, kea leboha, kea leboha" ha ke ntse ke matha ka phapusing ea ho phomola, mme yanked bula monyako o ka pele o apere t-shirt ea khale feela le li-boxer shorts. Ha a le moo, o ne a eme tseleng e nang le seqha se seholo se putsoa ho sona, e ne e le ford minivan.
yo: Mo yọ ara mi kúrò lọ́dọ̀ àwọn òbí mi mo sì kígbe pé "o ṣeun o ṣeun o ṣeun o ṣeun o ṣeun" bí mo ṣe ń sáré kọjá yàrá ìgbàlejò, mo sì ṣí ilẹ̀kùn iwájú tí ó wọ T-shirt àtijọ́ àti ṣòkòtò boxer. Níbẹ̀, tí ó dúró sí ọ̀nà pẹ̀lú ọwọ́ aláwọ̀ búlúù ńlá lórí rẹ̀, ọkọ̀ ford kékeré ni.

en: For the first time in weeks, she seemed completely and undeniably alive to me. She was alive. For one more day at least, she was alive. I had focused on her whereabouts for so long in an attempt to keep me from obsessively wondering whether she was alive that I had no idea how terrified I’d been until now, but oh, my God. She was alive.
vi: Lần đầu tiên từ mấy tuần nay, Margo trở nên hoàn toàn, không thể phủ nhận được, sống động đối với tôi. Cô ấy còn sống. Ít nhất thêm một ngày nữa, cô ấy vẫn còn sống. Tôi đã chú tâm quá lâu đến những lang bạt của Margo, để không bị ám ảnh trong mớ bòng bong băn khoăn không biết cô ấy còn sống hay không, lâu đến mức tôi không nhận ra rằng mình đã cảm thấy sợ hãi chừng nào, cho đến lúc này. Ôi, ơn Chúa. Cô ấy còn sống.
tr: Haftalardır ilk defa, Margo bana tamamen ve reddedilemez bir biçimde hayatta görünüyordu. Hayattaydı. En azından bir gün daha hayattaydı. Hayattaydı.
es: Por primera vez en semanas no tuve la menor duda de que estaba viva. Estaba viva. Y estaría viva al menos un día más. Me había centrado tanto tiempo en localizarla, sobre todo para evitar preguntarme obsesivamente si estaba viva, que no me había dado cuenta de lo aterrorizado que había estado hasta entonces, pero, oh, Dios mío. Estaba viva.
vi_translation: For the first time in weeks, Margo became completely, undeniably, alive to me. She was still alive. At least for one more day, she was still alive. I had focused for so long on Margo's wanderings, being obsessed with the tangled mess of wondering whether she was alive or not, for so long that I didn't realize how scared I had been until now. Oh, thank God. She was still alive.
tr_translation: For the first time in weeks, Margo looked completely and undeniably alive to me. She was alive. At least for one more day, she was alive. To stop myself from wondering whether she was alive or not, for so long she had been I was so focused on the place that I had no idea how scared I had been until now, but oh, my God... He was alive.
es_translation: For the first time in weeks, I had no doubt that she was alive. She was alive. And she would be alive for at least one more day. I had focused so much time on locating her, mainly to avoid obsessively asking myself if she was alive, that I hadn't realized how terrified I had been until then, but, oh, my God. She was alive.
